name: Pistol Squat (Single-Legged Squat)
how_to_perform:
1. Stand on one leg, with the other foot lifted off the ground and held in front of your buttocks for balance.

2. Keep your back straight, engage your core, and maintain a slow, controlled movement throughout the exercise.

3. Lower yourself down into a deep squat, keeping your back heel almost touching the ground and your back knee bent at around 90 degrees or slightly deeper if comfortable.

4. Push through your front heel to return to standing position, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.

5. Alternate legs with each repetition, focusing on slow, controlled movements that prioritize proper form over rapid completion.
short_summary: Pistol squats are a lower body exercise primarily targeting the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes, performed by balancing on one leg while lowering and raising yourself into a squat position.
